availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ephraim L. Van Winkle (Kentucky Sec. State)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, attorney and secretary of state. Wayne County, Kentucky, native. Son of Micajah Van Winkle and Mary Phillips Van Winkle. Married to Ellen Eliza Phillips Van Winkle. Father of Milton E. Van Winkle, Mary E. Van Winkle, Lucy A. Van Winkle, and Betty Van Winkle. Attended Monticello Academy. Graduate of the Louisville School of Law in 1850. Attorney in Wayne County, Kentucky in 1850. Member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from Wayne County in 1855. Commonwealth's attorney for the Sixth Judicial District in 1856. State elector for Constitution Union Party candidate John Bell in 1860. Attorney in Pulaski County in 1860. Employed James Cowan in 1860. Secretary of State of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from September 1863 to May 1866.
